content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and valid problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem, very clear  !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice iteration problem. It was not clear at the beginning what a "complete color" meant, but with a little reflexion it is ok.

Goal section
* Suggest to clarify that completed rows and columns only require them to be filled with 5 tiles, which can be of different colours.
(I was confused because when I read the statement, I thought rows and columns were completed only if they were filled with tiles of the *same* colour only.)

Cases
* Suggest to revise, regroup and add pairs of cases as follows:
   • 1 pair of test and validator where one or more rows are completely filled without any completed columns or diagonals.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where one or more columns are completely filled without any completed rows or diagonals.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where one or more rows AND one or more columns are completely filled without any completed diagonals.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where top-left to bottom-right diagonal is completely filled.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where bottom-left to top-right diagonal is completely filled.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where both diagonals are completely filled.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where the whole board is completely filled.
   • 1 pair of test and validator where no row, column or diagonal is completely filled.
   (I guess 8 pairs are quite sufficient, although you can still implement further detailed variations.)

Stub generator
* Suggest to delete "STATEMENT".

Thanks.

Anyone interested in playing the game can try it here against an AI of adjustable difficulty:
https://domwil.co.uk/games/tiles/
